diet: Increase iron-rich foods: Spinach, Red Meat, Lentils, Fortified Cereals.
Consume Vitamin C (Oranges, Lemon) to aid iron absorption.
lifestyle: Avoid tea/coffee immediately after meals (inhibits iron absorption).
medical: Consult a physician for iron supplementation dosage.
Follow up with a repeat CBC in 1-2 months.

diet: Increase Vitamin B12 intake: Eggs, Dairy, Poultry, Shellfish.
For vegans: Consider B12 fortified foods or nutritional yeast.
medical: Check Serum B12 and Folate levels.
Consult doctor for possible B12 injections or supplements.

diet: Maintain a balanced, nutrient-dense diet to support overall health.
medical: Focus on managing the underlying chronic condition (inflammation, infection, etc.).
Consult your primary care physician.

diet: Restrict simple sugars and refined carbohydrates (white bread, soda).
Focus on high-fiber foods, whole grains, and lean proteins.
lifestyle: Engage in regular aerobic exercise (walking, swimming) for 30 mins/day.
Monitor weight and aim for gradual weight loss if overweight.
medical: Test HbA1c to confirm diagnosis.
Consult an Endocrinologist for management.

diet: Limit Potassium (bananas, potatoes) and excessive Protein depending on stage.
lifestyle: Stay hydrated (unless fluid restricted by doctor).
Avoid NSAIDs (painkillers) that can harm kidneys.
medical: URGENT: Consult a Nephrologist immediately.
Monitor urine output and blood pressure.
Consult a Gastroenterologist.
Screen for Hepatitis if risk factors exist.

diet: Low-fat diet to reduce gallbladder stress.
medical: URGENT: Requires imaging (Ultrasound/CT) to check for biliary obstruction (stones/tumor).
Consult a doctor immediately for physical exam and possible antibiotics.
Symptomatic management (fever reducers).
Seek help if symptoms worsen or breathing becomes difficult.

diet: High fluid intake (coconut water, ORS) to prevent dehydration.
medical: CRITICAL: Monitor Platelet count daily.
Watch for warning signs (bleeding gums, severe abdominal pain). Hospitalization may be needed.

diet: Reduce Saturated Fats (red meat, full-fat dairy).
medical: Consult doctor for lipid profile monitoring.
Discuss statin therapy if lifestyle changes fail.
